item.title: He Had to Audacity to Go On TV After What He Did!
item.description: When Lynsey Wilson met Mitchell Quy she wasn‚Äôt aware of how controlling and abusive he was going to be. Join me in my latest True Crime episode where I take a deep dive into a story that will shock you to the core.

item.title: Daisy Coleman: Assault Allegations & Community Backlash
item.description: This case isn‚Äôt just about what happened to Daisy Coleman ‚Äî it‚Äôs about what happened after she spoke out. The backlash, the lack of accountability, and the long-term impact of not being believed all played a devastating role in her life. Do you think the justice system failed Daisy more ‚Äî or did her community? üí≠

item.title: The Keith Jesperson Case | The One with No Remorse
item.description: In the early 1990s, Keith Jesperson murdered at least eight women across the United States, earning the nickname ‚ÄúThe Happy Face Killer.‚Äù A long-haul truck driver, he used constant travel to avoid detection and later taunted police and media with anonymous letters signed with a smiling face. His crimes went unsolved for years before a confession revealed their scope. He is serving multiple life sentences. How was someone able to kill repeatedly while hiding in plain sight for so long?

item.title: Bodycam Captures What a Mother Should Never Do
item.description: These cases infuriate me as a mum. What in the world made her think that it would be OKAY in any scenario?!

item.title: They Found the Bodybags in Their Own SHED!
item.description: Robert Leo Marzejka suffocated, and beat to death his sister, Danielle and her boyfriend Seren Bryan in August 2018 in their mobile home. It is one of the most chilling stories I've ever covered. I cannot imagine how the family must have felt when they came in face to face with that room filled with flies with two big body bags just laying in there... What are your thoughts? Em x

item.title: The Bungalow Was Hiding a Twisted Truth
item.description: When you look at Juliana Redding's case, what do you think is the most unsettling part ‚Äî the betrayal by people she knew, the role money and influence played, or the way her potential was stolen so abruptly?

item.title: CCTV Captured How Cold-Bloodedly He Did It All!
item.description: He only got... 17 YEARS though??

item.title: Stepmom From Hell: Letecia Hardin
item.description: What‚Äôs so deeply disturbing about Gannon‚Äôs story is how completely it flips the script on what childhood should be ‚Äî a place of safety, predictability, and unconditional protection. Instead, he faced danger from someone who should have been nurturing him, not hurting him. Letecia‚Äôs actions weren‚Äôt just violent; they were calculated, layered with deception, and followed by a shocking attempt to rewrite the narrative. This case reminds us how critical it is to pay attention to small signs, to listen to children, and to acknowledge that sometimes the greatest danger comes from behind closed doors, not outside them. When you look at this case, what unsettles you the most ‚Äî the betrayal of a parental role, the manipulation that followed, or the heartbreaking loss of a child who trusted the very person who harmed him?

item.title: Pursued Without Escape In A Violent Walsall Attack
item.description: Bailey Atkinson, 21, was chased through Walsall‚Äôs market area and stabbed with machetes and so-called zombie knives in a revenge attack involving stolen cars. He later died from multiple wounds after open-heart surgery. How does group violence escalate to this level of brutality in public spaces?

item.title: He Poisoned Her PROTEIN Shakes!
item.description: A US dentist who poisoned his wife has been sentenced to life in prison without parole after a Colorado jury found him guilty of murder and other charges. James Craig, 47, had been having an affair when he plotted to kill his wife Angela Craig in March 2023. What do you guys think of this incredibly chilling case?

item.title: Monica Preyed on Her Own StudentÔøΩÔøΩ
item.description: Monica Elizabeth Young was just 23 when she began grooming a 14-year-old boy via Snapchat, then used her position of trust in a Sydney school to take things further in the classroom. This is another case which shows you that not all predators are male.

item.title: Obsessive Woman Realizes She's Finally Been Caught
item.description: In 2016, 49-year-old businesswoman Sadie Hartley was stabbed to death in her Lancashire home by Sarah Williams, driven by obsessive jealousy over a former partner. Williams planned the attack for months with the help of an accomplice, tracking Sadie‚Äôs movements before carrying it out. She was convicted of murder and sentenced to life in prison. Sadie‚Äôs death exposed how fixation and resentment can escalate into calculated violence. How can obsession go unchecked until it turns deadly?

item.title: Her Good Intentions Met With Cruel Betrayal
item.description: Ariana Wolk was a kind soul. She was the granddaughter of Rosemary LaBianca ‚Äî one of the victims of the Charles Manson ‚ÄúFamily‚Äù murders in 1969. She was discovered in her bed ‚Äúin a pool of blood,‚Äù having suffered sharp-force injuries to her neck, plus defensive stab wounds on her arms and hands. The details of this case chilled even the most seasoned detectives... What are your thoughts?

item.title: She Uploaded a Dance Video AFTER Losing Her Daughter!
item.description: This case boils my blood to a whole another level. Not even talking about the social media attention seeking, bringing an ABUSIVE stranger home... but not even calling the emergency services to save that precious child's life?? My heart aches for gorgeous, precious Kaylee... What are your thoughts?

item.title: A Confrontation At Home Turned Into Tragedy #carlygreg
item.description: A Confrontation At Home Turned Into Tragedy #CarlyGregg #storytelling

item.title: "Someone Left a Baby in My Van!"
item.description: Can you imagine the horror the family must have felt when their car was stolen with their baby inside? Nightmare fuel for parents and families!

item.title: The Unimaginable Dark Nature Of Julia Enright!
item.description: In 2019, 21-year-old Julia Enright was murdered in Cork, Ireland, by her former boyfriend, Paul McGrath, after a history of coercive control and escalating abuse. Despite their separation, McGrath continued to exert control over Julia before fatally attacking her. He was later convicted of murder and sentenced to life in prison. Julia‚Äôs case became a defining example in discussions about coercive control laws. How many warning signs must appear before abuse is taken seriously?

item.title: At 14, Carly Gregg Made A Choice That Changed Everything
item.description: In 2024, 14-year-old Carly Gregg was charged with murdering her mother, Ashley Smylie Gregg, inside their Mississippi home. Investigators say the killing followed a confrontation after her mother discovered troubling behavior. The case stunned the community due to Carly‚Äôs age and the alleged planning involved. It raised difficult questions about accountability, mental health, and warning signs inside families. How can such extreme violence emerge so young and so close to home?

item.title: Left Alone By Her Parents: The Case of Kaylea Titford
item.description: In 2020, 16-year-old Kaylea Titford was found dead in her home in Wales after suffering severe neglect. Born with spina bifida, Kaylea relied on full-time care, but investigators discovered she had been left in shocking conditions. Her father, Alun Titford, and mother, Sarah Lloyd-Jones, were convicted for gross negligence manslaughter. The case raised urgent questions about safeguarding and oversight.

item.title: Ran for 17 Years After Taking His Ex's LIFE!
item.description: This case is a reminder that behind every headline is a life stolen and a family forever changed. Let‚Äôs talk about the psychology, the missed warning signs, and how Holly‚Äôs story shaped the pursuit of justice. - Em x
